info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 23 at 11:50PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS WILL MAKE TRAVEL IMPOSSIBLE FOR PORTIONS OF THE NIAGARA FRONTIER OVERNIGHT... HAZARDS...The combination of a band of heavy snow and winds gusting to 65 mph is producing BLIZZARD conditions. Visibility within the band is ZERO. There are numerous vehicles stranded on the roadways. DO NOT attempt to travel in this band. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1142 PM EST, a 15 mile wide band extends from Lackawanna and Tonawanda northeast across the Northtowns and into northwest Genesee and portions of Orleans counties. This band is expected to drift a few miles north by 2 AM. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Tonawanda, Amherst, Lancaster, Medina, Albion, Williamsville, Grand Island, Pendleton, Pembroke, Akron, Erie Basin Marina and Small Boat Harbor. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 48A and 55. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
